Lebanese.title: Shawarma
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Lebanese.instructions: Mix olive oil, lemon juice, vinegar, garlic, cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Marinate chicken in mixture for 2 hours. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Cook chicken in batches until browned and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per batch. Warm pita breads. Spread tahini sauce on each pita. Add chicken and pickled vegetables. Garnish with parsley. Roll up and serve hot.

Lebanese.title: Hummus
Lebanese.instructions: In a food processor, combine chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, cumin, and salt. Process until smooth, adding water as needed to achieve desired consistency. Transfer to serving bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika and parsley. Serve with pita bread and vegetables.

Lebanese.title: Fattoush
ingredients: 2 pita breads, toasted and broken into pieces
Salt and black pepper to taste
Lebanese.instructions: In a large bowl, combine salad greens, cucumber, tomatoes, onion, mint, and parsley. Add toasted pita pieces. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, cumin, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve immediately.

Lebanese.title: Kibbeh
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Lebanese.instructions: Soak bulgur wheat in warm water for 30 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water. Mix bulgur with half the ground lamb, onion, pine nuts, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and pepper. Form mixture into oval shapes. Stuff with remaining ground lamb. Heat oil to 350°F (175°C). Fry kibbeh until golden brown, about 5-6 minutes. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

Lebanese.title: Baklava
Lebanese.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Layer 10 sheets of phyllo dough, brushing each with melted butter. Spread ground pistachios evenly. Layer remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter. Cut into diamond shapes. Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden brown. Meanwhile, make syrup by combining sugar, water, honey, lemon juice, vanilla, and cinnamon. Bring to boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Pour hot syrup over hot baklava. Let cool completely before serving.

Moroccan.title: Couscous
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Moroccan.instructions: Bring chicken stock to boil. Place couscous in a large bowl and pour hot stock over it. Cover and let stand for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Sauté onion and carrots until softened, about 5 minutes. Add zucchini and cook for 3 minutes. Add chickpeas, raisins, almonds, parsley, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes. Mix with couscous and serve hot.

Moroccan.title: Tagine
Moroccan.instructions: Heat olive oil in a tagine or large pot. Brown lamb on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside. Sauté onions and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add ras el hanout, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and saffron. Cook for 1 minute. Return lamb to pot. Add chicken stock and bring to simmer. Cover and cook for 1 hour. Add apricots, prunes, and honey. Cook for additional 30 minutes until lamb is tender. Garnish with almonds and cilantro. Serve hot with couscous.

Moroccan.title: Harira
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Moroccan.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Brown lamb on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside. Sauté onion and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add cumin, coriander, cinnamon, turmeric, and saffron. Cook for 1 minute. Return lamb to pot. Add chicken stock, tomatoes, chickpeas, lentils, and tomato paste. Bring to boil, then simmer for 1 hour until lamb is tender. Add cilantro and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Moroccan.title: Pastilla
ingredients: Cinnamon and powdered sugar for garnish
Moroccan.instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet. Sauté onion and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chicken, cinnamon, ginger, and saffron. Cook for 5 minutes. Mix in almonds and powdered sugar. Layer phyllo sheets in a round baking dish, brushing each with melted butter. Spread chicken mixture over phyllo. Cover with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing with butter. Brush top with beaten egg. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30-35 minutes until golden. Dust with cinnamon and powdered sugar. Serve warm.

Moroccan.title: Mint Tea
Moroccan.instructions: Place tea leaves in a teapot. Add fresh mint and sugar. Pour boiling water over tea and mint. Let steep for 5 minutes. Strain and serve hot in small glasses.

Egyptian.title: Koshari
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Egyptian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Fry onions until golden brown and crispy, about 10 minutes. Remove half the onions and set aside. Add garlic to remaining onions and cook for 1 minute. Add tomato paste, tomatoes, cumin, coriander, and chili powder. Simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Layer rice, lentils, and macaroni in serving bowls. Top with tomato sauce and crispy onions. Garnish with parsley. Serve hot.

Egyptian.title: Ful Medames
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Egyptian.instructions: Mash fava beans in a large bowl. Add garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well until smooth. Garnish with parsley and serve with hard-boiled eggs and pita bread.

Egyptian.title: Molokhia
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Egyptian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Brown chicken on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside. Sauté onion and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add coriander, cumin, and chili powder. Cook for 1 minute. Return chicken to pot. Add chicken stock and tomato paste. Bring to boil, then simmer for 30 minutes. Add molokhia leaves and cook for 10 minutes until thickened. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with rice.

Egyptian.title: Umm Ali
Egyptian.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Brush phyllo sheets with melted butter. Layer in a baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes until golden. Break into pieces. In a saucepan, heat milk, cream, sugar, and vanilla until sugar dissolves. Pour over phyllo pieces. Sprinkle with raisins, pistachios, almonds, coconut, and cinnamon. Bake for 20 minutes until golden and bubbly. Serve warm.

Egyptian.title: Shakshuka
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Egyptian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Sauté onion and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, cumin, paprika, and chili powder. Cook for 10 minutes until sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Make 4 wells in the sauce. Crack eggs into wells. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes until eggs are set. Garnish with parsley. Serve hot with bread.

Ethiopian.title: Doro Wat
Ethiopian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until softened, about 8 minutes. Add berbere spice and cook for 2 minutes. Add chicken and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and chicken stock. Bring to simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Add hard-boiled eggs and cook for additional 10 minutes. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with injera bread.

Ethiopian.title: Misir Wat
Ethiopian.instructions: Rinse lentils until water runs clear. Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until softened, about 8 minutes. Add berbere spice and cook for 2 minutes. Add lentils, tomato paste, and vegetable stock. Bring to boil, then simmer for 20 minutes until lentils are tender and mixture thickens. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with injera bread.

Ethiopian.title: Shiro
Ethiopian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until softened, about 8 minutes. Add berbere spice and cook for 2 minutes. Add chickpea flour and stir for 1 minute. Gradually add vegetable stock while stirring to prevent lumps. Add tomato paste and simmer for 15 minutes until thickened. Season with salt. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with injera bread.

Ethiopian.title: Gomen
Ethiopian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until softened, about 5 minutes. Add cumin, coriander, and turmeric. Cook for 1 minute. Add collard greens and water. Cook for 10-15 minutes until greens are tender. Season with salt. Serve hot with injera bread.

Ethiopian.title: Injera
Ethiopian.instructions: Mix teff flour, water, yeast, and salt in a large bowl. Cover and let ferment for 2-3 days at room temperature. Stir in warm water to make a thin batter. Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/2 cup batter into skillet and swirl to cover bottom. Cook for 2-3 minutes until bubbles form and edges lift. Remove and repeat with remaining batter. Stack injera between towels to keep soft. Serve with Ethiopian dishes.
